required_header.download_date: ClinicalTrials.gov processed this data on July 28, 2020
required_header.link_text: Link to the current ClinicalTrials.gov record.

clinical_study.brief_title: Developing Affective HeaLth to Improve Adherence to Health Behaviors in Diabetes (DAHLIA II)
clinical_study.official_title: Developing Affective HeaLth to Improve Adherence to Health Behaviors in Diabetes (DAHLIA II)

brief_summary.textblock: Participants will be randomly assigned to either a positive affect skills intervention or a psychoeducation control group and assessed with questionnaires before, during, and after the 8-week program, as well as at 3 months, 6 months, and 12 months after the end of the program.

detailed_description.textblock: Participants will be randomly assigned to either the Diabetes positive affect skills intervention or a psychoeducation control group. Both programs last 8 weeks and take place on a simplified research version of the Happify platform. Participants assigned to the diabetes positive affect program will have full access to Happify, with a track that focuses on building skills for greater happiness, reducing stress, and coping better with diabetes displayed as the feature track. Participants assigned to the psychoeducation (control) condition will be asked to complete a series of polls on various wellbeing topics, and then provided with some social comparison data about how their responses compared with the responses of other users, as well as information about why the well being topic is important. Participants will be asked to complete questionnaires before, during, and after the 8-week program as well as 3 months, 6 months and 12 months follow-up questionnaires after the program is complete, at which point study participation will end.

study_design_info.intervention_model_description: Users are randomly assigned between arms after completing baseline assessment and stay in that arm for the duration of the study.

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Positive Affect [Quality of Life in Neurological Disorders, Positive Affect and Well-being (Neuro-QOL)]
primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of 8-week intervention (baseline), immediate post-intervention (week 8), 3 month follow up, 6 month follow up, and 12 months post-intervention
primary_outcome.description: 9-item measure of positive affect and well-being

primary_outcome.measure: Change in Positive Affect [Patient-Reported Outcomes Measurement Information System (PROMIS) positive affect subscale]
primary_outcome.time_frame: From start of 8-week intervention (baseline), immediate post-intervention (week 8), 3 month follow up, 6 month follow up, and 12 months post-intervention

secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline to 3 months and 6 months post-intervention
From baseline of 8-week intervention to immediate post-intervention, and at 3, 6, and 12 months post-intervention
From baseline of 8-week intervention to immediate post-intervention, and at 3, 6, and 12 months post-intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Change in Diabetes distress [Diabetes distress scale (DDS)]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline of 8-week intervention to immediate post-intervention, and at 3, 6, and 12 months post-intervention

secondary_outcome.measure: Diabetes self-care adherence [Summary of Diabetes Self-Care Adherence (SDSCA)]
secondary_outcome.time_frame: From baseline of 8-week intervention to immediate post-intervention, and at 3, 6, and 12 months post-intervention
From baseline of 8-week intervention to immediate post-intervention, and at 3, 6, and 12 months post-intervention

arm_group.description: Participants use Happify and have the option to use a diabetes-specific track that focuses on building skills for greater happiness, reducing stress, and coping better with diabetes. Users may access a wide variety of 4-week programs and use them in any way they desire for the entire study period.

Participants complete a series of quizzes and polls on Happify designed to engage them in thinking about well-being topics, but without giving any specific instructions for how to promote well-being. Participants gain access to 8 weeks worth of content, but may repeat the content as often as they like in the follow-up period.

intervention.description: An online platform for conveying techniques from positive psychology, cognitive-behavioral therapy, and mindfulness-based stress reduction.

criteria.textblock:
Inclusion Criteria:
- Adults with Type 2 Diabetes
- No prior experience on the Happify platform (new user registration)
Exclusion Criteria:
- none
